content.webTitle: Super League: Wigan Warriors close in on capture of Martin Gleeson

fields.headline: Wigan close in on Gleeson signature
fields.bodyText: Wigan are poised to announce the signing of Martin Gleeson in a move that could see the England centre make his Warriors debut as early as Thursday for their Super League encounter against his former club St Helens. The Warriors are closing in on a deal to secure the services of Gleeson, who is not cup-tied after being left out of the Warrington team that overwhelmed York 56-10 on Saturday. Wigan are thought to have initially offered the full-back Richard Mathers and the centre Darrell Goulding in exchange for Gleeson, who was born in Wigan before being brought up in Australia. The 28-year-old moved to Warrington from St Helens for a fee of about £200,000 in 2005 in the aftermath of a betting scandal.
